to spring a fight for the future of

Misrata this man hameed Shiu Li risked
his life trying to push pro-government
forces away his wounds were not caused
by his enemies but by the inexperience
of his friends this is CJ chippers
reporting for the New York Times the
battle in misrata was one of the central

and overthrow the regime of Colonel
Muammar al-gaddafi this particular fight
took place in a small alley behind
Tripoli Street in Misrata like many
battles in misrata it was a close
quarters urban skirmish as the fighting
in Libya continues into its six-month
Libya's rebels have shown courage
endurance and determination but they
often lack a sense of tactics or
training and discipline this video shot
by independent journalist Andre Lyon on
April 24th shows both the rebels and
experience and the speed was which some
of them have learned at this moment
rebels with an m40 recoilless rifle
tried to shatter a wall roughly 25
metres away by in which they had
surrounded a group of pro-qadhafi
soldiers the m40 was designed to hit
tanks hundreds of meters away upright
and without cover and mr. shui li tried
to protect his friends firing from his
hip while his friends fired the m40
watch his weight at bits of metal and
pieces of the wall pull back hitting mr.
shui li who releases his rifle staggers

high in the thigh and often fatal wound
if his femoral artery has been severed
he will rapidly bleed to death he calls
out as other rebels covered his
evacuation his friends then demonstrated
developed sense of battlefield savvy
they rushed from a ditch and dragged mr.
xueling toward a building from where
other rebels are firing waiting there
doctors are organized to treat the

shui Lee's femoral artery has been open
the qaddafi soldiers are firing back the

the imported have been fired from much

use of the m40 showed a lack of

resulted in an avoidable casualty
they're savvy inside this building
begins to emerge as the rebels had
closed in on the surrounded Qaddafi
soldiers they had occupied this place
and cut small ports in the walls from
which to fire on their enemies nearby
and they'd opened a mouse hole at an
interior wall so they could approach the
Rena meat without exposing themselves
and evacuate casualties the same way a
few minutes later mr. shui li was
declared dead he had been his friend
said a mechanic another of the armed
civilians lost in a bitter war for which
he was in equal measures both intensely
committed and wholly unprepared Syrian
President Bashar al-assad faces
increasing international pressure to
stop his brutal crackdown of
demonstrations but so far his forces
have not back down and neither have
protestors tens of thousands of Syrians
took to the streets today the protests
were not unusual but this month the
Syrian military and security forces
retook two of the most rest of cities in
the country taman da zoo her fears among
some activists that the retaking of
those two cities might limit the size of
the demonstrations
thousands still turned out and though
they were unable to gather at a central
square they're simple presence in the
streets sent a strong message of
defiance against a government that has
shown every indication of trying to
crush the uprising by force for a week
there seemed to be growing international
pressure on syria but in the past couple
of days the pressure seems to subsided
at least anecdotally for days there was
speculation that president obama would
call on President Assad to finally step
down for week the Obama administration
has escalated its criticism of the
Syrian regime but stopped short of
calling for mr. esta to resign President
Assad has lost the legitimacy to lead
and it is clear that Syria would be
better off without him earlier this week
Turkish Foreign Minister akhmatova Sulu
visited Damascus and Turkish officials
say they were going to give mr. acid two
weeks to bring about meaningful reform
diplomats have heard those promises
before but at least this time they say
time may be running out in this week
there is growing criticism of Republican
congressional leaders fiscal policies
from economists in their own party since
republicans took over the house in
january after their midterm election
gains last november they really pushed
washington in a more fiscally
conservative direction after the past
two years of stimulus spending and tax
cuts the emphasis this year has been on
deficit cutting and spending cuts in
particular and now as our economy
continues to be weak there's a number of
private forecasters macroeconomists many
of whom are Republicans and some
establishment Republican figures who are
coming out and saying wait this isn't
exactly the right medicine at all for
the economy we've got and the deficit
reduction should be back loaded as they
like to say that is should take effect
when we know the economy is fully
recovered among the sort of old
establishment Republican figures who
have spoken out our Hank Paulson who was
president george w bush's treasury
secretary and martin feldstein who's one
of the most renowned Economist's ever to
work for republicans he was chairman of
ronald reagan's Council of Economic
Advisers what these critics are
proposing is really a two-pronged effort
one in the short term you would have
some stimulus whether spending
or tax cuts and to Congress could
simultaneously agree on a program of
spending reductions especially in
Medicare and Medicaid going forward and
tax increases that would not take effect
until the economy is recovered they say
the scale of our future debt is just too
great to be done with spending cuts
alone but this is unlikely to have any
impact on what the congressional
Republicans do going forward because
they are dedicated to opposing any and
all tax increases their base especially
the Tea Party inspired Republicans don't
want to see them raising taxes so that's
where your left and Democrats don't want
to put the entitlement programs Medicare
Medicaid and Social Security on the
table if Republicans aren't going to
consider higher revenues for the future
